p: Lignans are phenylpropanoids dimers made up of two coniferyl or sinapyl alcohol units bound together at the tails [ 74]. Isolariciresinol, taxiresinol, lariciresinol, pinoresinol, and their glycosides are examples of such compounds. There is a growing interest in lignans, especially because of their chemotherapeutic ability [ 75]. The most commonly present lignin compounds in conifer spp. are shown in Table 1.
